Copyvillain

COM 201 - Communications Ethics
  • Overview
  • Calendar
  • Assignments

This calendar lists all of the readings, assignments, and activities for the class. Remember that material needs to be read, and assignments completed prior to the class meeting they are listed for. For your convenience, I list the information for the upcoming class meeting at the top of the page, but consult the full schedule below to get a sense of whatâ€™s coming up in the weeks ahead.

NEXT CLASS:

Replace this

Monday August 24

  • Read:
  • Class Activity: Discussion of syllabus and class goals. What does "Ethics" mean, anyway?
  • Assignment Due: Create a google document for the class notes assignment and share it with the professor

    • Wednesday August 26

  • Read:
  • Class Activity: Discuss the internet-related ethical dilemmas we described in our notes for today (see below).
  • Assignment Due: In your class notes google doc, describe one ethical problem involving Internet Communications you have heard about or encountered. This can be any issue where people are unsure about the morality of a particular use of the internet. Describe how you have encountered this dilemma, why you think people are unsure of the right course of action in this case, and your best guess as to the ethically correct way to behave in this circumstance.

    • Friday August 28

  • Read:
    • Internet's Own Boy (film).
    • NOTE You need to screen the film, which is about 1 hour and 45 minutes long, before our class meeting.
  • Class Activity: Discuss the contested morality of copyright. What ethical claims do authors and consumers make with regards to access to information?
  • Assignment Due: Answer the question: Was it ethical for Aaron Swartz to download the articles he did from JSTOR? in your google notes doc and come to class ready to discuss.

    • Monday August 31

  • Read:
    • Meet The New Boss, Worse Than The Old Boss? (David Lowery)
  • Class Activity: Discuss the ethical grounds for authors to claim "ownership" of their creative work.
  • Assignment Due: In your notes document, briefly summarize your response to Lowery's argument. What was most convincing about his position? What was less convincing?
